query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 E già la vita di quel lume santo 8 rivolta s’era al Sol che la rïempie 9 come quel ben ch’a ogne cosa è tanto.
query.result:
**English:**
7 And already the life of that holy light 8 had turned to the Sun that fills it, 9 like that good which is so much to every thing.
**Cornish:**
7 Ha warlergh bys an golow sansel 8 a dro dhe'n Howl a wra dhe'n gorlan, 9 kepar henna da a wra dhe bub tra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Ahi anime ingannate e fatture empie, 11 che da sì fatto ben torcete i cuori, 12 drizzando in vanità le vostre tempie!
13 Ed ecco un altro di quelli splendori 14 ver’ me si fece, e ’l suo voler piacermi 15 significava nel chiarir di fori.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Ah, deluded and wicked souls, 11 who turn your hearts from such good, 12 directing your temples in vain!
13 And behold, another of those splendors 14 approached me, and his desire to please me 15 was evident in his shining appearance.
**Cornish:**
10 Ah, enevalow gwari ha gwresow gwella, 11 a dro dhe'n da magh a wra'gas dha galonow, 12 ow treylya dha demplow y'n gwaneth!
13 Ha war ena aral a'n splannderow 14 dhe'n fordh vy, ha'y vynvos dhe'n plesya vy 15 a wra dhe'n gweles y'n sklerheans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Li occhi di Bëatrice, ch’eran fermi 17 sovra me, come pria, di caro assenso 18 al mio disio certificato fermi.
query.result:
**English:**
16 Beatrice's eyes, which were fixed 17 upon me, as before, with dear consent 18 confirmed my desire.
**Cornish:**
16 Lagas Bëatrice, a wra settys 17 war'n vy, kepar kyns, a wra dhe'n prof dhe'n kar 18 dhe'n vynvos vy dhe'n skontya vy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 «Deh, metti al mio voler tosto compenso, 20 beato spirto», dissi, «e fammi prova 21 ch’i’ possa in te refletter quel ch’io penso!».
query.result:
**English:**
19 "Ah, blessed spirit," I said, "quickly grant my wish, 20 and show me that I can reflect in you what I think!"
**Cornish:**
19 "Ah, rydh dhe'n vynvos vy dhe'n skontya vy dhesto", me a leveris, 20 "ena spyrys bennak", ha rydh dhe'n prof vy 21 henna gallam y'n te dhe'n skontya henna vynnav!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Onde la luce che m’era ancor nova, 23 del suo profondo, ond’ ella pria cantava, 24 seguette come a cui di ben far giova:
25 «In quella parte de la terra prava 26 italica che siede tra Rïalto 27 e le fontane di Brenta e di Piava,
28 si leva un colle, e non surge molt’ alto, 29 là onde scese già una facella 30 che fece a la contrada un grande assalto.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Whereupon the light that was still new to me, 23 from its depths, where it had been singing before, 24 continued, as one who delights in doing good:
25 "In that part of the wicked land of Italy 26 that lies between Rialto 27 and the springs of the Brenta and the Piave,
28 a hill rises, and it does not rise very high, 29 from which a torch once descended 30 that made a great assault on the region.
**Cornish:**
22 Kepar henna an golow a wra nowyth vy, 23 a'y downder, le may hy kanas kyns, 24 a leveris kepar neb a wra dhe'n plesya vy dhe'n gwella:
25 "Y'n henna rann a'n tir Itali bras 26 a wra ynter Rialto 27 ha fentennyow Brenta ha Piava,
28 onan menydh a sevel, ha na wra dhe'n ughel meur, 29 le may onan flamm a dhiskynnas kyns 30 a wrug dhe'n pow an assay meur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Di questa luculenta e cara gioia 38 del nostro cielo che più m’è propinqua, 39 grande fama rimase; e pria che moia,
40 questo centesimo anno ancor s’incinqua: 41 vedi se far si dee l’omo eccellente, 42 sì ch’altra vita la prima relinqua.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Of this resplendent and dear joy 38 of our heaven, who is closest to me, 39 great fame remains; and before it dies,
40 this hundredth year will still be added: 41 see if a person should make himself excellent, 42 so that the first life leaves behind another.
**Cornish:**
37 A'n lowen magh ha kar a'n joy ma 38 a'n nef a wra moyha dhe'n fordh vy, 39 bràs klodho a wra; ha kyns henna mos vy,
40 henna kansvledhen cansvledhen a wra dhe bymp. 41 Gweles poynt yma neb dhe wul excelles, 42 kepar henna'n bys kynsa a wra dhe'n fordh vy.

**English:**
43 And this the present multitude does not think of, 44 which Tagliamento and Adige enclose, 45 nor does it repent for being beaten yet;
46 but soon it will be that Padua will change 47 the water that bathes Vicenza to a marsh, 48 because of the cruelty of the people to their duty;
49 and where Sile and Cagnan join, 50 such a one rules and goes with his head held high, 51 that already the net is being made to ensnare him.
**Cornish:**
43 Ha henna nyns yw posek an bobel ma, 44 a dheghek Tagliamento ha'n Adice, 45 na'n keffrys ev dhe ves dhe benathy.
46 Mes byghan bythak Padova dhe'n palud 47 a wra dhe'n dowr a voengh Vincenza, 48 rag an kruethek a'n bobel dhe'n dleal.
49 Ha le may Sile ha Cagnan omdhyskyn, 50 onan a'n sywlygor ha mos dhe'n ben ughel, 51 a wra dhe vos an ragna dhe vos gwrys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Piangerà Feltro ancora la difalta 53 de l’empio suo pastor, che sarà sconcia 54 sì, che per simil non s’entrò in malta.
query.result:
**English:**
52 Feltro will still weep for the default 53 of its wicked shepherd, who will be so vile 54 that no one like him ever entered the ditch.
**Cornish:**
52 A wra Feltro kewsel dhe'n difalta 53 a'y bescob drog, a wra sconk, 54 marow bythak nyns esa dhe vos yn malta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Troppo sarebbe larga la bigoncia 56 che ricevesse il sangue ferrarese, 57 e stanco chi ’l pesasse a oncia a oncia,
58 che donerà questo prete cortese 59 per mostrarsi di parte; e cotai doni 60 conformi fieno al viver del paese.
query.result:
**English:**
55 Too large would be the vat 56 that would receive the blood of Ferrara, 57 and weary he who would weigh it ounce by ounce,
58 which this courteous priest will give 59 to show himself to be of a party; and such gifts 60 will be in keeping with the life of the country.
**Cornish:**
55 Re beuhes an bigoncia 56 a resevsa an gwydh Ferrarese, 57 ha stanco an neb a'y peusa onsa dhe onsa,
58 a wra an parson kurteys ma 59 rag diskwedhes dhe vos a-barth; ha'n donsow ma 60 a wra konform dhe vewnans a'n pow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Sù sono specchi, voi dicete Troni, 62 onde refulge a noi Dio giudicante; 63 sì che questi parlar ne paion buoni».
query.result:
**English:**
61 Up there are mirrors, you say Thrones, 62 from which God judging shines upon us; 63 so that these words seem good to us.
**Cornish:**
61 Ughel yw'n spekulys, why a lever Troni, 62 le mayl dhe'n Duw barn a wra refuljans dhyn; 63 marow an lavarow ma a wra da ni dhe vos da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Qui si tacette; e fecemi sembiante 65 che fosse ad altro volta, per la rota 66 in che si mise com’ era davante.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Here he fell silent; and he made it seem to me 65 that he had turned to something else, because of the wheel 66 in which he placed himself as he was before.
**Cornish:**
64 Ama henna ev a wra tewes; ha'm gwreugh 65 ev dhe vos troys dhe neppyth aral, rag an rota 66 yn may ev a wra dhe vos avel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 L’altra letizia, che m’era già nota 68 per cara cosa, mi si fece in vista 69 qual fin balasso in che lo sol percuota.
query.result:
**English:**
67 The other joy, which was already known to me 68 as a dear thing, appeared to me 69 like fine balas ruby in which the sun strikes.
**Cornish:**
67 An les an aral, a wra ges genys dhyn 68 rag neppyth ker, a wra dhe vos dhe'm gweles 69 marow balasso da yn may an howl a wra'n daras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Per letiziar là sù fulgor s’acquista, 71 sì come riso qui; ma giù s’abbuia 72 l’ombra di fuor, come la mente è trista.
query.result:
**English:**
70 To bring joy up there, brightness is acquired, 71 just as laughter here; but down below, 72 the shadow outside darkens, just as the mind is sad.
**Cornish:**
70 Rag lesi orth ena fulgor a wra gwynnes, 71 marow hwarow ama; mes y'n-nans a wra tewl 72 an avow a-ves, marow an menes yw trist.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 «Dio vede tutto, e tuo veder s’inluia», 74 diss’ io, «beato spirto, sì che nulla 75 voglia di sé a te puot’ esser fuia.
query.result:
**English:**
73 "God sees everything, and your seeing is hidden in Him," 74 I said, "blessed spirit, so that no 75 desire of itself can be hidden from you.
**Cornish:**
73 "Duw a wel an oll, ha'th gweles yw yn-nans," 74 a lever, "spyrys benoweth, marow nyns yw neppyth 75 a-gan dhe vos dhe vos kuhes dhytho."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Dunque la voce tua, che ’l ciel trastulla 77 sempre col canto di quei fuochi pii 78 che di sei ali facen la coculla,
79 perché non satisface a’ miei disii? 80 Già non attendere’ io tua dimanda, 81 s’io m’intuassi, come tu t’inmii».
query.result:
**English:**
76 Therefore, your voice, which always delights heaven 77 with the song of those pious fires 78 that make a cowl with six wings,
79 why does it not satisfy my desires? 80 I would not have expected your question, 81 if I had understood myself, as you understood me.
**Cornish:**
76 Marow henna, dha lef, a wra'n nebes orth 77 bythak gans an kan a'n tanow pious 78 a wra gwruthyl an kukulla gans whegh esel,
79 peraga nyns yw ev dhe vos dhe'm dysyr? 80 Nyns esa'm dhe vos dhe attal dha dhyskas, 81 mar esa'm dhe vos dhe'm dhyskynny, marow ty dhe vos dhe'th dhyskynny.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 «La maggior valle in che l’acqua si spanda», 83 incominciaro allor le sue parole, 84 «fuor di quel mar che la terra inghirlanda,
85 tra ’ discordanti liti contra ’l sole 86 tanto sen va, che fa meridïano 87 là dove l’orizzonte pria far suole.
query.result:
**English:**
82 "The greatest valley into which water spreads," 83 his words then began, 84 "outside of that sea which garlands the earth,
85 between the conflicting shores against the sun 86 it goes so far that it makes a meridian 87 where the horizon usually rises.
**Cornish:**
82 "An vale moyha yn may an dowr a wra'n lewys," 83 a lever ytho ytho y ger, 84 a-ves a'n mor ma a wra'n gurland an nor,
85 ynter an letyow discordyans orth an howl 86 mar bell ytho, a wra gwruthyl meridyan 87 ena le may an orison a wra gwruthyl a-rag.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Di quella valle fu’ io litorano 89 tra Ebro e Macra, che per cammin corto 90 parte lo Genovese dal Toscano.
query.result:
**English:**
88 Of that valley I was a native 89 between Ebro and Macra, which by a short route 90 divides the Genoese from the Tuscan.
**Cornish:**
88 A'n dowr-gwynna ma'n genys genys 89 ynter Ebro ha Macra, neb a fordh berr 90 a rann an Genovesek a'n Tuskan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Ad un occaso quasi e ad un orto 92 Buggea siede e la terra ond’ io fui, 93 che fé del sangue suo già caldo il porto.
query.result:
**English:**
91 At almost a sunset and a sunrise 92 Buggea sits and the land from which I came, 93 which once made its harbor warm with its blood.
**Cornish:**
91 A-dro dhe'n howl ha dhe'n jydh 92 Buggea a-sith ha'n tir ow a-dhybri, 93 neb a wrug hy porth tomm gans hy gwydh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Non però qui si pente, ma si ride, 104 non de la colpa, ch’a mente non torna, 105 ma del valor ch’ordinò e provide.
query.result:
**English:**
103 However, here there is no repentance, but laughter, 104 not for the sin, which does not come to mind, 105 but for the valor that ordained and provided.
**Cornish:**
103 Mes na wra gonisowghys ena, mes a-hedhir, 104 na rag an pegh, neb na wra dhe'n poynt, 105 mes rag an nerth a urdhys ha purvewys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Qui si rimira ne l’arte ch’addorna 107 cotanto affetto, e discernesi ’l bene 108 per che ’l mondo di sù quel di giù torna.
query.result:
**English:**
106 Here one gazes again at the art that adorns 107 so much affection, and one discerns the good 108 for which the world above returns to the world below.
**Cornish:**
106 Ena yma a wellir yn an arta neb a-berth 107 kemmys affection, ha'n da a-wra vyth 108 rag an bys an bys a-ucha y'n bys a-woles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Ma perché tutte le tue voglie piene 110 ten porti che son nate in questa spera, 111 proceder ancor oltre mi convene.
query.result:
**English:**
109 But because you bear all your desires fulfilled 110 that were born in this sphere, 111 it is fitting for me to proceed even further.
**Cornish:**
109 Mes rag an pub vyth oll ow desiryow 110 ow porth lenys neb a veu genys ena, 111 owth a-wra dhe'm dhe'n fordh moy bella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Tu vuo’ saper chi è in questa lumera 113 che qui appresso me così scintilla 114 come raggio di sole in acqua mera.
query.result:
**English:**
112 You want to know who is in this light 113 that sparkles here beside me 114 like a ray of sun in pure water.
**Cornish:**
112 Whans yw ow tos ow pyw yn an goleudh ma 113 neb a-sith ena owth owth a-berth 114 dell bell owth an howl yn dowr kler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Or sappi che là entro si tranquilla 116 Raab; e a nostr’ ordine congiunta, 117 di lei nel sommo grado si sigilla.
query.result:
**English:**
115 Now know that Rahab is tranquil there within 116 and joined to our order, 117 and in the highest rank she is sealed with it.
**Cornish:**
115 Mes whans owth a-wra ena ena yma a-sith 116 Raab; ha dhe'n urdh ni conjunys, 117 yn y renk moy uhella yma a-sith selys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Da questo cielo, in cui l’ombra s’appunta 119 che ’l vostro mondo face, pria ch’altr’ alma 120 del trïunfo di Cristo fu assunta.
query.result:
**English:**
118 From this heaven, where the shadow ends 119 that your world makes, before any other soul 120 was assumed into the triumph of Christ.
**Cornish:**
118 A'n nef ma, ena yma an scudh a-ben 119 neb a wra an bys owth a-wra, kyns moy esel 120 a veu dhe'n trymf Krist assumptys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Ben si convenne lei lasciar per palma 122 in alcun cielo de l’alta vittoria 123 che s’acquistò con l’una e l’altra palma,
124 perch’ ella favorò la prima gloria 125 di Iosüè in su la Terra Santa, 126 che poco tocca al papa la memoria.
query.result:
**English:**
121 It was fitting for her to be left as a palm 122 in some heaven of the high victory 123 that was acquired with one palm and the other,
124 because she favored the first glory 125 of Joshua in the Holy Land, 126 which the pope scarcely remembers.
**Cornish:**
121 Mes o'th a-wra dhe'y hy leel dell palm 122 yn nebes a'n ughella trymf 123 neb a veu gwynns gans an palm ha'n palm aral,
124 rag ena a-favoryas an kynsa glory 125 a Josue yn Tir Sen, 126 neb an pab na wra moy kov dhe'n poynt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 La tua città, che di colui è pianta 128 che pria volse le spalle al suo fattore 129 e di cui è la ’nvidia tanto pianta,
130 produce e spande il maladetto fiore 131 c’ha disvïate le pecore e li agni, 132 però che fatto ha lupo del pastore.
query.result:
**English:**
127 Thy city, which is lamented by him 128 who first turned his back on his Creator 129 and by whom envy is so lamented,
130 produces and spreads the accursed flower 131 that has led astray the sheep and the lambs, 132 because it has made a wolf of the shepherd.
**Cornish:**
127 Dha drev, an gwynnys gans an neb 128 a drehevis kyns an kynsa Fatyor 129 ha'gas yw an gonvedh a-ugh yn neb,
130 a wra dhe flogh malethys, 131 a dhrehevis an davas ha'n eneth, 132 rag yma a wrug an gwella a'n bleujy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Per questo l’Evangelio e i dottor magni 134 son derelitti, e solo ai Decretali 135 si studia, sì che pare a’ lor vivagni.
query.result:
**English:**
133 Because of this, the Gospel and the great doctors 134 are abandoned, and only the Decretals 135 are studied, so that it seems to their vicars.
**Cornish:**
133 Rag hemma, an Awen hag an doktor magh 134 yw trehedhys, ha yn unnik dhe'n Dekretals 135 yma studhyans, marnas dhe'n vikars.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 A questo intende il papa e ’ cardinali; 137 non vanno i lor pensieri a Nazarette, 138 là dove Gabrïello aperse l’ali.
query.result:
**English:**
136 To this the pope and the cardinals devote themselves; 137 their thoughts do not go to Nazareth, 138 where Gabriel opened his wings.
**Cornish:**
136 Yn hemma yma an pab hag an kardinalow 137 a wra aga meddylyow dhe Nasareth, 138 le may Gabrïel a egoris aga eselyow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Ma Vaticano e l’altre parti elette 140 di Roma che son state cimitero 141 a la milizia che Pietro seguette,
142 tosto libere fien de l’avoltero».
query.result:
**English:**
139 But Vatican and the other choice parts 140 of Rome that have been a cemetery 141 to the soldiery that Peter followed,
142 will soon be free from the adulterer.
**Cornish:**
139 Mes Vatikan ha'n rannoryow erel 140 a Rom, a veu kymynva, 141 dhe'n soudoryon a sewys Peder,
142 a vydh frank a'n avoulterer yn skon.
